title: Tulpehocken Road
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. James H. Beal
provenance_text:
Benton Murdoch Spruance [1904-1967], Philadelphia, PA; Frank K. M. Rehn, Inc., New York, NY, until March 1949; Mr. [1898-1987] and Mrs. James H. Beal (born Rebecca Huebley Jones) [1898-1993], Pittsburgh, PA, March 1949 until March 25, 1959 [1]; gift to Department of Fine Arts, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, March 1959 [2].

Notes:
[1]. Mrs. Beal purchased this "Tempera Painting" from the Rehn gallery for $500 in March 1949 (see curatorial file for copy of invoice and correspondence with Mrs. Beal from the Rehn archives at Archives of American Art.) Mrs. Beal was in possession of the work by February 26, 1949.
[2]. The work was listed on May 5, 1955 among a group of items at Carnegie Institute belonging to Mrs. Beal. It was later accessioned by the museum on March 25, 1959.
